item.title: Sticky Keys and Utilman against NLA
item.author: mubix
item.description: At CCDC, Sticky Keys via RDP was a very successful re-entry point for the Red Team. You can read more about how this works here: http://carnal0wnage.attackresearch.com/2012/04/privilege-escalation-via-sticky-keys.html So if you can get physical access or SYSTEM/Admin access at some point and enable + reach RDP, you can very easily follow those instructions and gain a level of persistance without the need of a pesky password :-) However, this doesn’t work so well with the advent of NLA or Network-Level-Authentication, which was enabled for Vista systems and beyond.
